content: Would be better with m4b chapter support.
Has major bugs still to resolve although does work. Resets to start of book regularly and the download function is very buggy. Still I will keep using in the hope it improves

Am really liking this app. Has made transferring audiobooks to my phone painless, the Player is good and does what i need it to (previously I was using SmartAudio) There is some initial effort required setting up the server / port forwarding but on Window this easy enough with a setup provided and there is plenty of documentation and help online, incl. a sub on Reddit.
Somewhere over the past year the download and offline featureset went to hell in a hand basket. This used to be the reason I paid for this thing and now it never seems to work. So üò¢
replyContent:
Sorry to hear that you are having problem, would you mind sending a big report next time it happens so I can look in to what the problem might be?

There was a few problems with changes in Android 11 when that came out but it should be fixed in the Booksonic version you are using so your problem is lost likely something else that I need to fix.

content: One of my fav all time apps. Had a big issue recently and developer was quick to help me out.
replyContent: Sorry to hear that. The cloud instructions are an option because people have asked for it, they are not the only option, you can still run it on your own computer as most do. Contact me with details on support@booksonic.org and we'll try and get it working for you again.

content: Small bugs here and there with bookmarks. Other than that the ui is a little funky. Overall great app.
replyContent:
Happy you like it :)

As for UI, you will be happy to know that I totally agree with you and improving that is one of the highest prio at the moment.

content: Booksonic is a handy way for you to combine your audiobook library from different websites into one library. It does take a little effort and some tweaking to get everything working correctly though.
replyContent: Happy to hear you like it

content: I love this app. I really enjoy being able to access all my books on the go. I don't know if it is possible but a sleep timer would be amazing! Either way thanks for making this app.
replyContent: That's awesome to hear! A sleep timer is already in there. On the now playing view, click the clock icon in the top right next to the casting icon to set it.

content: Good book app
replyContent: Happy to hear it

content: Great to listen to while exercising.
replyContent:
Happy to hear it!
It's not just me that listen to books instead of music then :)

content: Perfect
replyContent: Happy to hear it

content: Very nice App!üëå
replyContent: Happy to hear it

content: I haven't even really used this to listen to anything yet, but it is always the top battery user despite rarely being used. Almost need to uninstall when I'm not using. Edit: thanks to the developer for pointing me to the setting that saved me from killing my battery. Now my only issue is that the media notification keeps popping up every day regardless of not using it.
replyContent: Sorry to hear that, that's not supposed to happen. Even with heavy use most just get a few percent. That said I know some implementations of Android can have this problem. Try going in to settings - casting and disable DLNA, that will most likely solve your problem.

content: Have to give it a 5 star üåü for the brainy idea, you own this app, wait for the copies,.. 5 coz no adverts, .
replyContent: Happy to hear you like it. The "you own this app" part is very important to me, I want this to be able to continue working if something happens to me in the future and I'm unable to continue working on it so I'm very glad to hear someone notice that.

content: Why is there only few books
replyContent:
The books you are seeing are on the demo server, they are just there to show how it works. I am working on getting more books for the demo but the main reason for the app is to set up your own server and add your own books to it.

You can find instructions on https://booksonic.org

content: Nice audio book streemer
replyContent: Happy to hear it

content: Fabulous.I liked it.
replyContent: Happy you like it

content: Great effort and its close to being good, but this is kind of the only game in town outside plex, so thank you to the developer for your effort. Server was kind of a pain to install, got tomcat failures until I gave up and used the docker version. Not the end of the world. However, the M4B file support is not there at all. First, the server was trying to transcode it to mp3 and failing miserably, making invalid files that wouldn't open. OK, so I disabled the transcoding, redownloaded the file, still doesn't play with the android app. However, there is nothing wrong with the file as I can take the downloaded book and play it with any other audiobook app. So this is purely a player problem in the android app. So now what, do I spend a ton of time converting from a lossless format to mp3 so this app works? Do I use this app soley as a download management app and play books with another app? Edit: I did go through the work and converted everything to chapterized MP3 and its been flawless with that so far. App has issues with M4B files and some large single MP3 files. If you split them, fix the metadata, seems like it works just fine.
replyContent:
Yea the m4b support is very hit and miss, it seem like more miss then hit lately unfortunately

As for Air, no not at the moment. That said, adding features to Air will be much more possible then the old server so I'm hoping to better support it in the future. I'm also looking at natively support it in the app so that transcoding won't be necessary

content: I like this app. I really do it's just not a very easy to work with application. Like when I lock my phone. For whatever reason the story is playing then stops after about five minutes then I have to enter back into the app to press play just to find out I am back where I started when I locked my phone. There is so much promise for this app to be great so I am looking forward to seeing where this goes.
replyContent: Glad you like it. It sounds like your phone is killing off the Booksonic process, most likely it is the battery optimization that is doing it for some reason. Next time it happens, head on to the Booksonic settings - help/support and send me a log file. We'll see if we can't get it fixed for you, it definitely shouldn't be doing this.

content: Why can't I even log in on the app? It says my password is incorrect even though I changed it from my computer and know for a fact it is correct, otherwise how did I log in on the computer??
replyContent:
Most likely the address is incorrect, version 2008 of the app has better messages for this and should be live on Google Play soon

Make sure you have http/https in the beginning and if you are using tomcat/docker make sure you have /booksonic at the end

If it still doesn't work, click use demo server, go to settings - support and send me a log

content: Has been working great and been sharing with others
replyContent: Happy to hear it, let me know if you run in to any problems or have suggestions for improvements

content: App is slow, clunky and unpolished, and just doesn't appear to work particularly well
replyContent: Sorry to hear it, if the app is slow it might be that you have a bad connection to your server. Next time you experience a problem feel free to send me log file from settings - support and I'll try and get it fixed for you

content: I am using this with a docker container and find it to work very well. Download media while at home for offline use is very efficient. Happy user, would buy again.

content: This is the Plex of audiobooks. If you listen to them, this is a must!

content: Battery drain, and always shows up in notifications despite closing it.
replyContent: Sorry to hear that. Try going in to Settings - Cast and disable DLNA, on some implementations of Android this can cause battery drain. As for the notifications, there is a setting for Persistent notification that you can turn off. It is found under  settings - Playback

content: Great app, works just fine. Only issue I have is with the server, not being able to sync podcasts

-Tested the demo server, got the bug which didn't allow playback (another user on reddit encountered it) -Tried downloading something from the demo server to see if playback worked offline. Content didn't download at all -Enter in correct user name and password (tested on both computer and phone browser) and the application would not accept it I've put in a few hours trying to get something that should be working to work and I give up.
Great app, no and issues, and well done on a great initiative! Worth the purchase. Thanks.
replyContent: Happy you like it

content: Giving 5 stars based on best for self hosting, it would be amazing if we could upload audio books from our mobile devices to our servers.

content: Fantastic! Thank you for the demo books. The app works great, I've already uninstalled the other audiobook player I had. Update: Appreciate the info, I'll check it out. Best of luck to you friend. I will be sure to recommend your app to anyone who's looking.

content: Nice

I had a 16 hour book cut off at 6 hours yesterday and now I can't even get it to refresh back to the correct duration. This is the second time this has happened. It's extremely frustrating.
replyContent: Hmm, it should keep downloading even if you pause or bookmark. I will look in to this, thanks for letting me know. If it happens again it would be great if you could send me a log file directly after it happens. You can do that from Settings->Support->Send log

content: The best audio book app for your own book collection.

Sorry to hear that. Unfortunately the m4b support is a bit hit and miss

If you go to the bookmark menu and start from there does that work? It sounds like you might be clicking the file instead of the top play icon in the books which would cause the bookmark to not be used (will be fixed in later version)

For support, contact support@ptjwebben.se

content: Used to love this app. Stopped working since last two updates, no support apart from asking for logs. Works through browser, app doesn't connect Edit: thanks for the suggestion, unfortunately the app still doesn't connect (LAN or WAN) using the proxy setting, whilst the browser does, so I can only see this as an app fault.
replyContent:
I am sorry you are still having problems. I sent a reply but as that does not appear to have arrived I'll try and answer short here (limited number of characters)

The problem is a self signed certificate, normally the app does not allow this but you can force it to by going to settings - cast and check Use device proxy. Contact if still probl

content: It's the best server/app combination I've found so far. Could do with some more features on the server side though!

The app supports skip forward/backward. Either you tap on the "timeline" where you want to skip to or you can skip 10 seconds at a time by tapping the forward/backward icons.

Sorry to hear you don't like it. If you would like a refund let me know at support@ptjwebben.se

Sorry you are having problems
Try force closing the app and then clear the cache, this should hopefully fix your problem, if not contact me at support@ptjwebben.se

content: constantly looses it's place.
replyContent:
Hi,

Next time you experience this, please send me a log file and I will take a look at what might be causing it. It shouldn't do that.

You can send a log file from the main menu of the app, tap the three dots at the top right corner and then on Send log

//Patrik

content: Can't skip the progress bar alway returns to the start
replyContent:
Hi,

This can happen if the file has not been cached fully yet, if so, just wait for the download to complete. More likely is that your books are in m4a or m4b format, that will cause this problem as well. 

If none of this is true in your case please send me a log file next time it happens to you and I will look in to what is causing it.

content: A great partner for Booksonic. The features (downloading/caching of tracks, variable speed, bookmarks, timer) work very well and it's great to see the app is still being updated. Recent changes to the buttons are appreciated.
It will not connect to my booksonic server served via https. I was excited to try this, too.
replyContent:
Please send me a log file and I will look in to what the problem might be. My personal server is using https so it should be possible to get it working for you.

You can send me a log file by tapping the three dots at the top right corner and then Send Log

content: Any ETA on adding adjustable playback speed?
replyContent:
Hi Zach,

I know you already found it but for others reading this review. Adjustable playback is in the app already (for Android 6 and newer) and can be found under the clock icon. It is a bit unintuitive at the moment since the same icon is also used for the sleeptimer so this will be updated in a later version.

You can do that from the dots at the top right corner

If you change your mind about using the app let me know and we can have a look at what might be the problem with sync as it should work.

replyContent:
Most likely a permission error but since Sarah was not able to send a log file due to app not opening this was not verified. If anyone else has this error please contact support@ptjwebben.se since I am unable to replicate it myself and have no other reports about it it would be a great help.

Purchase has of course been refunded.

content: Works fine for me. No crashes. Does just what I needed
replyContent: Glad you like it

content: Wish it could sync playback position between web and phone. Better than Plex in many ways except the most important ones -no Alexa support and cannot sync between web player and phone. Bummer. Will keep my configs just in case this is added at some point

issues. The only reason I'm still using it is that I can't find anything 
else like it.
replyContent: Are you still having problems in the newer versions? There was a fix implemented in one of the newer versions that fixed to most common crashes.

content: This is, by far, the worst phone app I've ever purchased.  This app frequently crashes.  Even so, it's the best solution I've found (so far) to access a Booksonic server.
replyContent:
Sorry to hear that. The next time the app crashes for you, send me a log file and I  will check why it isn't working for you.
You can send the log from within the app by pressing the three dots at the top right of the main view.

content: Absolutely amazing stuff. Once you configure it, it is perfect. Configuring is not that hard. I chose the docker container for the server. Once a few books are on the server and you can play them from any home computer via your web-browser, you can try android client configuration. The little confusing stuff for me was that it could not connect initially, but then I realised - you have to choose your home access point name (SSID). That makes sense - so that booksonic client does not try to connect to server in any other networks. Greatest thing for audiobooks. And I am not even mentioning podcasts yet - subscribe to any rss easily and keep episodes on your home server.
replyContent:
Glad you like it!
Actually you should be able to connect to it even from outside your network as long as you use your public IP in the server address field and forward your ports in the router. When the SSID is set and matching the network you are currently on the app will instead connect to the IP in the field Local Network Address.

content: App is great. Sometimes the position in the book is lost on restarts. After pausing the audio the battery seems to drain rapidly with background CPU usage time very highly.
replyContent:
Glad you like it:)

A fix for the battery/CPU problem some Android 7 phones had has been included in Booksonic 1.0.12. To enable the fix go to settings -> casting and you will find it at the bottom. 
Credit for the fix goes to the DSub developer.

content: Can't connect to my reverse Proxy, because AES256 cipher suites are unable to connect.  Any way you could allow any of these suites:  Cipher Suites TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_256_GCM_SHA384 TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_256_CBC_SHA384 TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_256_CBC_SHA  ? I know Java does not support these by default.. Otherwise a great app!

Configuring this app is a real headache if you aren't network savvy. I finally got to pull up by books on my android device but I cannot access them remotely which means if I'm away from the house I cannot stream or begin syncing new tracks to listen to later.  I was pretty certain I read that the server allowed for remote access but I could be wrong.
replyContent:
Remote access is indeed supported.

As your previous version of the comment stated that you have tried using your public IP you seem to be on the right track. It sounds like the problem you are having is either that you need to port forward your router or that the traffic is blocked by a firewall on the computer running the server.

content: Really like the idea of an audiobook server, and have started to implement it, but am struggling with how to organize the server's files. Is there a help file or advice. I would like to divide the audobooks by genre, then author, then title.  How many subdirectory levels is supported? Can you implement Genre's as a top level selection? I created sub-directories like "fiction" "Mystery" "sci-fi" . My family will be more into using this if they don't have to wade through titles they are not interested in.  Thanks so much for your hard work.
I would like chapter support for m4b files
Does what it says, however not really updated often. Would be great if you could fix a few issues specifically the one with using sleep timer making the app crash after the timer runs out.
replyContent:
Glad you like it.
Yes that definitely sounds like a bug that needs fixing. I haven't had any reports about it earlier and I don't have it so I wasn't aware it existed. Please let the app crash and then start it again and send me your log file. You can do that from inside the app, just tap the three dots at the top right corner and select Send Log.

content: Unfortunately I can't really use it on the road because I don't get a unique ip address from my provider.. Anyone know a way around that?
replyContent:
Glad you like it :)

You would need some kind of tunneling to get it online if you don't have your own IP. I have very limited space to answer here but post it on the subreddit as well and I'll explain it a bit more

http://reddit.com/r/booksonic

content: I really am excited to see an audiobook version of the subsonic apps.  One thing I really wish it had would be an ability to have variable speed with pitch correction on playback.  I use Smart Audiobook Player a lot and I listen at 1.3x normally.  I am not sure I can get used to listening to the audiobooks at a normal speed after doing it for so long at 1.3x.    Otherwise I appreciate your efforts so far!  The server works great too.  I will need to tweak my metadata and album covers though.  A lot seem to either not exist in my folders.  Some of my mp3s have the cover in the metadata as well.  Maybe the server does not look for them?
replyContent:
Got good news for you, variable playback speed will be in the next release.
The server should look at the tags (but priority is folder structure). The covers however need to be added as images in the book folder, for example as cover.jpg

content: The UI is really quite terrible. I don't  want to have the organization of my audiobooks based on the directory structure. I definitely don't want the tracks for my audiobooks sorted lexicographically by the title tagtag, especially if the numerical track number is available! It's interesting to compare this with Plex ‚Äî they essentially know they are providing an alternative to Netflix sourced with private content, so they made their UI as similar to Netflix as possible. This app should look like Audible.
replyContent: The app is supposed to sort the tracks by track number when available so if it doesn't do that for you please contact me at support@ptjwebben.se and I will try and help you. It's unfortunate that you don't like the UI but I want to clarify one thing, it is not meant to be an Audible replacement, it is meant to be a Subsonic for Audiobooks.

content: App does what it advertises but I am trying to figure out if my streaming sessions from the app can be linked by the web so I can play from webpage where I left off.  The scraper on the server lays the information neatly and clean in the app.  Very simple design, has more options than I expected and the developer listens to the people who purchase it.
replyContent:
At the moment no, but it is planned.
Glad you like it
